entry.title: Van Morrison knighted in Queen's honours list
Lady Gaga, Van Morrison honored at songwriters ceremony
Songwriters Hall of Fame honors Van Morrison, Lady Gaga
entry.summary: Recording artist Van Morrison gestures on the red carpet before the Songwriters Hall of Fame ceremony in New York, June 18, 2015.

entry.title: Lady Gaga, Van Morrison honored at songwriters ceremony
entry.summary:
Morrison and Lady Gaga picked up honorary prizes, while awards also were presented to Nate Ruess and the former CEO of the American Society of Composers Authors and Publishers (ASCAP), John LoFrumento.

Honoree Van Morrison performs at the 46th Annual Songwriters Hall Of Fame Induction and Awards Gala at the Marriott Marquis on Thursday, June 18, 2015, in New York.

entry.title: Morrison breaks through at CWS in TCU's 10-3 win over LSU
entry.summary:
Only one pitcher in TCU history has won more games than Preston Morrison, and none has worked more innings.

Schlossnagle said he wants Morrison well-rested because he anticipates needing the Chicago Cubs' eighth-round draft pick again.

entry.title: Van Morrison gets knighthood in queen's birthday honors
entry.summary: Morrison is among more than 1,000 people recognized by the queen in her annual Birthday Honors list for their achievements and services to the community.

entry.title: Van Morrison gets knighthood in queen's birthday honors
entry.summary:
Acclaimed singer and songwriter Van Morrison is joining a select group of music giants with a knighthood to their name.

The Belfast-born Morrison was honored Friday by Queen Elizabeth II for his services to music and tourism in Northern Ireland, the inspiration for many of his classics.

entry.title: Van Morrison gets knighthood in queen's birthday honors
Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
entry.summary: NEW YORK (AP) - A handwritten poem by Jim Morrison found among his possessions in the Paris hotel where he died in 1971 ends with the line "Last words, Last words out."

entry.title: Poem by Jim Morrison found in hotel room where he died is being auctioned online
entry.summary:
Morrison was the lead singer of the 1960s rock group the Doors.

This undated photo provided by Paddle8 shows a hand-written poem by Jim Morrison that is being auctioned, with bidding expected to reach 60,000 to $80,000 by the time it ends June 25.

entry.title: Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
entry.summary:
Morrison moved to Paris in 1971 to take a break from performing and to focus on his writing.

It's written in Morrison's own hand, deals with the themes of death and snakes, and was found in the hotel where he died.
